description: Farmers have presented arguments for and against the supply management bill proposed by the Bloc Québécois to the Liberals as a condition for supporting the minority government. In exchange for backing the Liberals in non-confidence votes, the Bloc has set an Oct. 29 deadline for passing Bill C-282 into law. The bill passed the Commons […]
title: Farmers Make Their Cases for and Against Bloc’s Supply Management Bill

description: Many parents in British Columbia are confused by the new descriptive grades that have replaced letter grades on report cards to convey students’ performance in school, a recent study by Fraser Institute finds. When asked to choose the correct meaning of two of the new descriptive grades—“Extending” and “Emerging”—from a list of choices, more than […]
title: Most BC Parents Confused by Province’s Descriptive Grading System in Schools: Study

description: The outcome of the Queensland election will likely be pored over by political strategists in the lead-up to the federal election.
title: 8 Key Takeaways From the Queensland Election Result

description: Nova Scotia Premier Tim Houston has called an election for Nov. 26, well ahead of the fixed election date of July 15, 2025. Houston visited the official residence of Lt.-Gov. Arthur Joseph LeBlanc in Halifax on Oct. 27 to dissolve the legislature and call the election. At dissolution, the Nova Scotia legislature had 34 Progressive […]
title: Nova Scotia Premier Calls Snap Election

description: Dockworkers at the Port of Montreal walked off the job early Sunday for a one-day strike aimed at putting pressure on their employer amid difficult contract talks. The union representing nearly 1,200 longshore workers at the country’s second biggest port served notice Thursday for a complete work stoppage from 7 a.m. Sunday until Monday morning. […]
title: Montreal Dockworkers Hold One-Day Strike to Put Pressure on Employer

description: TORONTO—More Canadian homeowners are considering switching to variable rate from fixed rate mortgages after an unusually large interest rate cut by the central bank on Wednesday, mortgage brokers said. The Bank of Canada cut its benchmark policy interest rate by 50 basis points to 3.75 percent, giving some relief to homeowners after mortgage payments shot […]
title: Canadian Homeowners Consider Switch to Variable Rate Mortgages After Big Rate Cut

description: When B.C. teenager Amanda Todd sat in front of her computer and detailed the relentless bullying and extortion she’d faced on social media, it sent a shock wave to parents around the world. Twelve years later her family is joining others in a lawsuit alleging those dangers persist for kids online. Only a few weeks […]
title: Amanda Todd’s Family Joins American Parents in Lawsuit Against Social Media Giants

description: The federal transportation minister says national co-operation is needed to close loopholes criminals can use to re-sell stolen cars. Anita Anand’s office has sent letters to her provincial and territorial counterparts calling for meetings to discuss the issue of Vehicle Identification Numbers being changed on stolen cars which are then resold, a process known as […]
title: Transportation Minister Looks for Provinces, Territories to Collaborate on Car Thefts

description: The job applications in the public sector have hit a record high amid China's unemployment crisis and gloomy economy.
title: Millions of Chinese Apply for Limited Supply of Government Jobs

description: Western experts dismiss the notion of BRICS states ditching the dollar given the greenback’s central role in today’s globalized economy.
title: Russia’s Landmark BRICS Summit and the Specter of De-Dollarization

description: JERUSALEM—One person was killed and dozens were injured on Sunday when a truck struck a bus stop at a major intersection near Tel Aviv in central Israel in what police said they suspected was a terrorist attack. Israeli police said about 40 people were injured to varying degrees, including some seriously, and were taken to […]
title: One Killed, Dozens Injured in Truck Ramming at Israeli Bus Stop

description: HAVANA—A small town in Cuba was recovering Tuesday from flooding that killed at least seven people after Oscar crossed the island’s eastern coast as a tropical storm with winds and heavy rain. Cuba’s capital was partially illuminated after a large-scale blackout generated a handful of protests and a stern regime’s warning that any unrest would […]
title: Cuba Fights to Come Back From a Nationwide Blackout, Then a Storm That Killed 7

description: TALISAY, Philippines—The number of dead and missing in massive flooding and landslides wrought by Tropical Storm Trami in the Philippines has reached nearly 130 and the president said Saturday that many areas remained isolated with people in need of rescue. Trami blew away from the northwestern Philippines on Friday, leaving at least 85 people dead […]
title: At Least 126 Dead and Missing in Massive Flooding and Landslides in Philippines

description: It’s still a close race in British Columbia’s election as recounting continues, but the NDP has gained a lead in two ridings that were tight. In the general election held on Oct. 19, the BC NDP won or was leading in 46 ridings, the BC Conservatives won or were leading in 45 ridings, and the […]
title: BC NDP Widens Margin Over Conservatives as Voting Recount Continues

description: Three people are dead after the light planes they were travelling in collided midair over Sydney’s southwest, with first responders describing the incident as “unsurvivable.” Emergency crews responded to reports the planes collided about 11:50 a.m. on Oct. 26 in the vicinity of Belimbla Park near Oakdale. Responders located the first aircraft, a Cessna 182, […]
title: 3 Dead in ‘Unsurvivable’ Midair Plane Collision

description: An Australian student subjected to an unprovoked and lengthy bashing by 12 of his classmates has been granted $1.2 million in compensation. The student at Fairvale High School, in western Sydney, was 14 years old when the other students prevented him boarding a bus on Oct. 16, 2017. The pack then walked him to a […]
title: Student Awarded $1.2 Million After School Gang-Bashing

description: The Green's position may have been undermined by their ongoing support for radical protest movements.
title: Greens Suffer Major Swings, LNP and Labor Back in the Contest for Inner-City Voters
